comments.body:
These four cases already work:

```sclala
scala> import org.apache.spark.sql.types._
import org.apache.spark.sql.types._

scala> MapType(StringType, DecimalType(5, 5)).sql
res3: String = MAP<STRING, DECIMAL(5,5)>

scala> ArrayType(StringType).sql
res4: String = ARRAY<STRING>

scala> DecimalType(38, 5).sql
res5: String = DECIMAL(38,5)

scala> StructType(StructField("operation_log", StringType) :: Nil).sql
res6: String = STRUCT<`operation_log`: STRING>
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +167,171 @@    assert(DoubleType.sql == "DOUBLE")
    assert(FloatType.sql == "FLOAT")
    assert(StructType(StructField("operation_log", StringType) :: Nil).sql ==
      "STRUCT<`operation_log`: STRING>")
    assert(DecimalType(38, 5).sql == "DECIMAL(38,5)")

comments.body:
```
scala> FloatType.sql
res8: String = FLOAT

scala> DoubleType.sql
res9: String = DOUBLE

scala> LongType.sql
res10: String = BIGINT

scala> ShortType.sql
res11: String = SMALLINT

scala> IntegerType.sql
res12: String = INT

scala> NullType.sql
res13: String = NULL
```

why do we need this?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +161,165 @@
  test("sql method of each data type") {
    assert(NullType.sql == "NULL")
    assert(IntegerType.sql == "INT")
    assert(ShortType.sql == "SMALLINT")
